They told you there was no way that explosions could heal people, but they were foolsâ€¦ Fools who didn't understand your brilliance! You create a minor explosion from your innovation, altering the combustion to cauterize wounds using vaporized medicinal herbs. You or a living creature adjacent to you regains [[/r ceil(@actor.level/2)d10[healing]]]{level based healing}. In addition, the creature you heal can attempt an immediate flat check to recover from a single source of persistent bleed damage, with the DC reduction from appropriate assistance.

Base [[/r {1d10}[healing]]]{1d10 Hit Points}. At 3rd level, and every 2 levels thereafter, increase the healing by 1d10.

Special If your innovation is a minion, it can take this action rather than you, though because it's not a living creature, it can't use the ability on itself.

@Check[type:flat|dc:17|name:Unstable Flat Check|showDC:all|traits:unstable]{Unstable Check}

On a failure, the innovation malfunctions in a spectacular (though harmless) fashion, such as a belch of smoke or shower of sparks, and it becomes incapable of being used for further unstable actions.

On a critical failure, you also take [[{@actor.level}[fire]]]{fire damage equal to your level}.
